data.title: Visits by Foreign Leaders
data.text: Prime Minister Tomiichi Murayama Japan Official working visit. January 10–12, 1995 President Isaias Afwerki Eritrea Working visit. January 15–February 5, 1995 President Mircea Snegur Moldova Working visit. January 29–February 2, 1995 Prime Minister Lamberto Dini Italy Met with President Clinton en route to a G-7 conference in Canada. February 2–3, 1995 Chancellor Helmut Kohl Germany Official visit. February 9–10, 1995 Prime Minister Jean-Luc Dehaene Belgium Official working visit. February 11–15, 1995 President Zhelyu Zhelev Bulgaria Working visit. February 12–15, 1995 Prime Minister Willem (Wim) Kok Netherlands Official working visit. February 26–28, 1995 President Jerry Rawlings Ghana Official working visit. March 8–9, 1995 King Hassan II Morocco State Visit. Afterwards visited New York City. Departed March 24. March 15–17, 1995 President Franjo Tudjman Croatia Attended commemoration of the first anniversary of the Bosnian-Croatian Federation. March 15–16, 1995 Prime Minister John Bruton Ireland Working visit. Later visited New York, Chicago, and St. Louis; departed March 24. March 16–18, 1995 Prime Minister James Bolger New Zealand Met with President Clinton during a private visit. March 25–29, 1995 King Hussein Jordan Met with President Clinton during a private visit. Arrived in the U.S. March 24; also visited Los Angeles, Rochester (Minn.), and New York City. Departed the U.S. April 7. March 26–April 2, 1995 President Hosni Mubarak Egypt Official working visit. April 1–5, 1995 Prime Minister John Major United Kingdom Official working visit. April 2–4, 1995 Prime Minister Benazir Bhutto Pakistan Official working visit. Arrived in the U.S. April 5; also visited New York City and Los Angeles. Departed the U.S. April 14. April 9–11, 1995 Prime Minister Tansu Ciller Turkey Met with President Clinton during a private visit. Arrived in the U.S. April 17 in New York City. Later attended Houston (Tex.) International Festival. April 18–20, 1995 President Fernando Henrique Cardoso Brazil State Visit. April 19–22, 1995 Prime Minister Vaclav Klaus Czech Republic Working visit. May 3–5, 1995 Prime Minister Yitzhak Rabin Israel Met with President Clinton during a private visit. May 5–8, 1995 President Robert Mugabe Zimbabwe Official working visit. May 17–19, 1995 President Jacques R. Chirac France Attended U.S.-EU Summit meeting. June 14–15, 1995 President Nicephore Soglo Benin Official Working Visit. July 12–15, 1995 President Kim Yong-sam Korea State Visit. Addressed a joint session of Congress and attended dedication of the Korean War Memorial. July 25–28, 1995 Prime Minister Jean-Claude Juncker Luxembourg Official working visit. August 6–8, 1995 President Ernesto Perez Balladares Panama Official working visit. September 5–7, 1995 President Sali Berisha Albania Working visit. Afterwards visited Boston and New York. September 10–13, 1995 Prime Minister Percival James Patterson Jamaica Working visit. September 11–13, 1995 President Ion Iliescu Romania Working visit. September 25–29, 1995 Prime Minister Yitzhak Rabin Israel Attended signing of Israeli- Palestinian Interim Agreement. Afterwards visited New York. September 28–30, 1995 President Hosni Mubarak Egypt Attended signing of Israeli-Palestinian Interim Agreement. September 28–30, 1995 King Hussein Jordan Attended signing of Israeli- Palestinian Interim Agreement. September 28–30, 1995 Pope John Paul II Vatican City Pastoral visit. Met with President Clinton in Newark, NJ; addressed the U.N. General Assembly in New York. Also visited Baltimore, MD. Departed the U.S. October 8. October 4, 1995 President Ernesto Zedillo Ponce de Leon Mexico State visit. October 9–11, 1995 King Harald V Norway Met with President Clinton during a private visit. October 12–17, 1995 President Suleiman Demirel Turkey Working visit. October 18, 1995 President Thomas Klestil Austria Working visit. October 18–20, 1995 President Ketumile Masire Botswana Attended Africare dinner with President Clinton. October 19, 1995 President Ange Patasse Central African Republic Attended Africare dinner with President Clinton. October 19, 1995 President Muluzi Bakili Malawi Attended Africare dinner with President Clinton. October 19, 1995 Prime Minister Meles Zenawi Ethiopia Attended Africare dinner with President Clinton. October 19, 1995 King Mswati III Swaziland Attended Africare dinner with President Clinton. October 19, 1995 President Pasteur Bizimungu Rwanda Attended Africare dinner with President Clinton. October 19, 1995 Prime Minister Manuel Saturnino Guinea-Bissau Attended Africare dinner with President Clinton. October 19, 1995 President Vaclav Havel Czech Republic Attended dedication of the Czech and Slovak Museum and Library in Cedar Rapids, Iowa. October 21, 1995 President Michal Kovac Slovakia Attended dedication of the Czech and Slovak Museum and Library in Cedar Rapids, Iowa. October 21, 1995 Prime Minister Janez Drnovsek Slovenia Met with President Clinton at the UN General Assembly in New York City. October 22, 1995 President Boris N. Yeltsin Russia Summit meeting with President Clinton at Hyde Park, New York. October 23, 1995 President Franjo Tudjman Croatia Met with President Clinton at the UN General Assembly in New York City. October 24, 1995 President Alia Izetbegovic Bosnia-Herzegovina Met with President Clinton at the UN General Assembly in New York City. October 24, 1995 President Jiang Zemin China, People’s Republic of Met with President Clinton at the UN General Assembly in New York City. October 24, 1995 President Jose Eduardo dos Santos Angola Official working visit. December 7–9, 1995
